name: Pathiri
history: Pathiri is a traditional flatbread from the Malabar region of Kerala, India. It's made from rice flour and is known for its thin, soft texture.
description: Pathiri is a delicate, gluten-free flatbread made from rice flour, traditionally served with curries or coconut milk. It's a staple in Kerala cuisine and is enjoyed for its light, soft texture.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: Boil water with salt and coconut oil. Add this to the rice flour and knead into a smooth dough.

instructions.title: Roll the Pathiris
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a thin circle, using rice flour for dusting.

instructions.title: Cook the Pathiris
instructions.description: Heat a skillet. Cook each pathiri until it puffs up, flipping once. Apply ghee or oil as needed.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the pathiris hot with curry, stew, or coconut milk.

tips: The dough should be soft and pliable for the best texture.
Do not overcook the pathiris to maintain their softness.
variations: Add cumin seeds or grated coconut to the dough for a different flavor.
Experiment with different types of rice flour for variations in taste.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat on a skillet before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a skillet until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve on a banana leaf for an authentic presentation.
Accompany with a variety of curries for a complete meal.
